Module pre-requisites can be found [here](https://andrewcparnell.github.io/bhm_course/Prerequisites.html). All the raw files and code can be found [here](https://github.com/andrewcparnell/bhm_course) (click 'Download ZIP' near the top right if you want offline versions of everything). All links below are in pdf format for you to annotate. A glossary of technical terms is [here](https://andrewcparnell.github.io/bhm_course/glossary.html).

## Day 1: Basic concepts

Time  | Class
------------- | ----------------------------------------------------
9:30-10:30 | [Introduction to Bayesian hierarchical models](https://rawgit.com/andrewcparnell/bhm_course/master/slides/class_1_intro.pdf)
10:30-10:45 | Coffee break
10:45-11:45 | [Likelihood and inference](https://rawgit.com/andrewcparnell/bhm_course/master/slides/class_2_inference.pdf)
11:45-12:00 | Coffee Break 
12:00-12:45 | Guided practical: Loading data in R and running simple analysis [(R code)](https://rawgit.com/andrewcparnell/bhm_course/master/practicals/tutor_1_R_basics.R)
12:45-14:00 | Lunch
14:00-17:00 | Self-guided practical (including coffee breaks) [(html)](https://rawgit.com/andrewcparnell/bhm_course/master/practicals/practical_1_using_R_for_lr_and_glms.html) [(pdf)](https://rawgit.com/andrewcparnell/bhm_course/master/practicals/practical_1_using_R_for_lr_and_glms.pdf)
